climbs.name: South Face
climbs.fa: June 1968 by Brad Fowler and Chuck Ray

content.description: Follow the obvious chimney in the center-left of the face for two pitches, cross a left-trending chimney system and head straight for the (false) summit.
content.location: Scramble along the ridge west until you gain the notch between the False and Actual Summits.  Descend down and west until you gain the sandy bench that you started on.

content.description: Traverse underneath the South Face until reaching a sandy notch that gains the separating the Impala from the Springbok.  Start climbing 10 feet to the left of the notch.  All difficulties along the ridge can be bypassed to the left.  Excellent cracks on the final "headwall" pitch lead to the (false) summit.  4-5 pitches total.
content.location: Follow the descent directions for the South Face.

climbs.name: The Diagonal Route
climbs.fa: November 1968 by Fred Beckey and Charlie Raymond

content.description: Follow the obvious crack/chimney system that starts in the center of the face and trends right.  When the chimney gains the East Ridge, there are several 1-2 pitch options to finish the route at the (false) summit.
content.location: Follow descent information for the South Face.
